_exec_summary.SummaryText: 1. Facility Policy: The owner, management and employees of Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Iola are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and law enforcement personal to mitigate any release to residents and the envirnoment of our community.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   2. Facility Information:  The primary activity at the facility is the storage and sales of fertilizer to farm producers in the area.  Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Iola anhydrous ammonia operation is leased from Iola Grain, which has been at this location for over 32 years.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            A.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrients.                                                                                                                                                                              B.  The maximum quanitity stored would be 121,877 pounds.

3.  Accidental Release Prevention Program:  The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61-1" published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc.  After normal duty hours the local Police Department inspects our area, approximately every two hours.  Anything out of the ordinary is reported to our 24 hour telephone number and the police take necessary actions.  The Iola Fire Department conducts an annual fire inspection of the facility.                                                                                                                                                                                4.  Five-Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or signifivant property damage at this facility, nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.                                                                                                                                                                              5.  Emergency Response Program:  Our facility has a written Emergency Action Plan.  Employees are trained to respond to minor releases of anhydrous ammonia, but we do not plan to have our employees respond to major release.  If a large release of andydrous ammonia takes place at our facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the release, call 911, and call all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.  Additional facility emergency contact is Mr. John Tanner, assistant manager, (620) 228-8058.

6. Planned Changes to improve Safety: Install larger safety barriers (bumper poles) to protect equipment.  Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility.                                                                                                                                                                                7.  For further information contact Mr. Dave Comstock, Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Iola, 505 W. Lincoln, Iola, KS 66749, (620) 365-9582.
